column4: I'm having trouble installing Win98 SE onto a machine with Xubuntu 7.10
I'm having trouble installing Win98 SE onto a machine with Xubuntu 7.10
Instead of repeating the same question, why not explain what the problem is
It loads the setup off of the cd, but at random times through the setup it gives an insufficient memory error
How are you trying to install it? to the hard drive or some sort of virtual..
To the hard drive. I spent all of yesterday installing xubuntu but its slower then win98 anyhow, so I want to go back to it.
Then you need to ask in #windows.. it isnt a Ubuntu problem..
Yes sir :P
How much ram are you running in that box
192mb
How much of that is shared with your video card?
I'm not sure, its a laptop that I haven't touched in awhile
Either way, if you are going back to 98.. one of the better windows versions.. Itisnt an issue for here.  But reducing the shared video will help with the linux install
How would reduce the shared video inside of xubuntu?
You cant do it inside the os.. it is a bios thing..
K Thanks for your help
np
I can't find where to change the shared memory in the Bios
Not sure of your hardware.. but it is not always clear, but is always marked video something
I'll take another look
I can't find it anywhere, do you know of any ways to make xubuntu faster? Or another distro thats lightweight and has wireless support?
dsl.. damn small linux or something like that..  check distrowatch..
A minute of your time please
You must follow each upgrade, dont skip//
